reviewText: Hmmm...a hard call, this one.  It's certainly not asking an unreasonable price for what it offers, especially on sale, and it's certainly not anyone's definition of incompetent".  It is
recommended: a little hard to imagine just who I would consider "recommending" this game to
hoursPlayed: bar perhaps those masochists out there who think that constantly moving between rooms as instructed to perform myriad menial tasks
voteText: whilst avoiding the floaty ghosts of butchered beasties
votesHelpful: it would at least be a passable time-waster if the saves were regular
votesTotal: but every unspectacular death just means several minutes of getting back to where you were beforehand
votesFunny: and the satisfaction of a job successfully completed is marginal at best.\n\nNow...I know that this arguably sounds like an awful lot of games out there
commentsCount: including some which I hold in incredibly high esteem
column16: such as Outlast.  I guess I maybe just require slightly "deeper" gameplay if I'm not going to be served oodles of ATMOSPHERE in the overall package
column17: and the fine line between "horror" and "retro"/"arcade"-style antics is perhaps a little too skewed to the latter for my liking in this case.  It really may just be a personal taste thing
column19: and the vegetarian in me definitely wants to like the sheer perversity of this crazy little slice of madness.  It's really
column20: REALLY not "bad" at all.  Maybe it's just not my bag
column21: and maybe it will be yours.  Hence the recommendation...that
column22: and the lack of a "neutral" button for me to push
column23: because this game really is about as "middling" as it gets in my book.\n\nLet me try putting it another way:  If you like super-duper old-school "arcade" games
column24: with just a splash of horror (and the good old red stuff) to give it a bit of context
column25: then you may well enjoy this.  I don't think it's going to hit anyone's all-time top-ten lists
column26: but it may well be worth the two bucks or less if you're feeling suitably indiscriminating and just feel like killing a bit of time while you butcher a few cartoon carcasses.  For me
column28: its appeal ran its course pretty quickly.\n\nDefinitely NOT to be filed in the Lone Survivor/Claire-style category of genuinely "creepy" pixelated homages to Silent Hill
column30: though I guess it is at least marginally spookier than Commando or Pac Man.  The very definition of a "take-or-leave-it" proposition
column32: and for now I'm choosing to leave it.  Good luck to the dev
column34: as they seem sincere enough in their intentions
column36: may well go on to (much) bigger and better things...\n\nVerdict: 5.5/10."

reviewText:
This game is on to something--bringing back classic controls and a feel good plot: chopping carcassus. I'll go over the pros and cons of this game:

Pros:
Music--good old school creepy with that I know something is coming but I'm sticking around anyway vibe"
Controls--easy to use controls
date: reminiscent of games like Doom.\nPlot--simple plot; excellent time killer at work. Not so involved that you lose track of 3 hours of your life
recommended: but enough tasks to keep you occupied\nNuances--sound effects
voteText:
and the map with rooms with objectives marked with an "X" all make this an easy game to enjoy and understand immediately

Cons:
Rewards--not enough blood per carcus! Maybe there could be bonus blood for ghost evasion?--if that already exists then disregard!
No offense--I'd like to have a way to kill the floating goat ghosts!"

reviewText:
A cheap thrill. It’s short but doesn’t fall short of the asking price.

The game is playable, and the dev says there will be updates. Which I hope will be timed and built on towards 2016’s Halloween as competing thematically with #Xmas and #StarWars doesn't sound like a good idea to me.  There’s a lot of potential here and it’s worth the asking price in it’s current state.

Pros--
1) Music and sound are great.
2) Map is simple.
3) Controls are simple and work well when navigating the game.
4) Graphics are retro and work with the tone of the game.
5) Overall sense of fear is there. I felt tense and scared when the sound effects to opening doors. One door in particular was scary, and I thought a monster would be waiting for me. No monster, but I was scared during most of my first play through.

Cons--
1) Story could be more developed and better. It would be nice if the butcher had a kid and/or a wife he had to provide for. Or, maybe someone will die if the butcher doesn’t figure out the mystery at work.

2) Lack of variant game modes or gameplay. I think if the story was developed more, the game could be better developed. Like having a metagame to take care of a sick child in a hospital, etc. Or heck, even a love interest who visits the Butcher during the day. Eventually, as I got better, the tension was less, and thus my fear lowered increasingly.

3) Lack of caring about if I die. It sucks “yes” that you have to start over if you are killed, but I just feel I have to redo the work I did before, that the only reason I want to live is to finish my work and not a meta game or a compelling story.

4) No Steam Cards or Achievements.
Update was promised in the community when I post this review, but steam cards wouldn't add to the game as other things could.

Again, I think this is rough version of what could be a better game for a higher asking price, and I hope come Halloween 2016 to see some major updates or even a sequel.

reviewText:
Blood...Blood...Blood...Blood...Blood...Blood...Blood...Blood...Blood...Blood...
T.T
The baby was scared to death。
Baby in the heart bitter, but the baby does not say.
So	 6/10

Pretty fun!

Pros:
The controls are perfectly responsive. Really easy going, but very old school in their feel.
The sound overall is stellar for what it is.
Pace of the game is perfect for an arcade style throwback
Bloody and fun!

Cons:
Offense would be nice
More game modes would be too, but this is a very good start.
Randomly crashed after my first death, but that could also be a flash issue.

Overall, it's pretty fun, definitely got my money's worth!

Can't believe the negative reviews. This isn't a dude walking around a flawlessly bug free environment with generic tasks and no explicit storyline or sense of joy, wonder & fun... okay.. it is, but it's a statement, I think. Goodnight Butcher.. may you rest in peace.

Took some time to get to this game, but I'm honestly glad I did. My first play around went smoothly, couldn't find any bugs or issues with the cut scenes. Games flows really well and I like how they slowly add various challenges as it goes. I know some of you will say otherwise but kind of has a little serious sam meets 5 nights at freedies cross vibe going, but also very easy going. Music is good not over powering which for a lot of games I mute flat out. This is Def a game I'll be playing during streams in between match rounds.\n\nThe one con i feel is the no mouse option, not sure if this is going to be added in later or not but would add more elements to the game if it did. Will very much keep an eye out for updates and watch how they progress the game.

reviewText:
Wander rooms, collect the things, take them to the other things before finally taking them to the last thing. Rinse, repeat. All while being pursued by a slow moving monster.

The first warning sign was when I noticed how many positive reviews listed the game being bug free" as a pro. I guess in the age of Steam Greenlight that is kind of a rarity.

And they're not wrong. The game works
date: and I didn't notice any bugs. I also didn't have any fun.\n\nI've played worse games for sure
recommended: but given the current state of Greenlight and Early Access that can't really be considered a good recommendation."

reviewText:
I only have under an hour of gameplay in at this point, but I'm seeing the reviews favoring the negative. I feel as if I should write a review now and then modify it if my opinion changes because I don't think this is a mostly negative" game.

Pros:
Simple controls
Simple objectives complicated by stacking challenges
Good feel and atmosphere
Pretty tense when you're trying to carry a carcass while trying to outrun a spooky
It's under two bucks
The word "carcass" is used

Cons:
I felt like some of the objects in the game were a tad clunky to manuever around
date:
but that may just be the learning curve
I'd like to see a visible carcass while holding one (on character) as well as a floor carcass when one is dropped.
Game is not titled "Carcass Dropping Simulator"

I enjoy this game and can see updates improving any issues the negative reviewers are complaining about.

reviewText: This game isn't fun. Follow instructions to chop up meat and display it in the front case of a butcher shop that has been closed while trying not to get caught by the demons that randomly lock doors and try to kill you. That one sentance is the whole game but in a constant loop. I think you're supposed to making offerings of blood but it doesn't make sense that you're trying to apease a blood god but in return demons are coming after you to kill you which would stop you from making more offerings. The story could be good but I don't want to play more to find out. The repetative actions of getting meat, cutting meat, and putting meat on display is what's preventing me from wanting to play more.
